answers.answer: Yes, go straight to an endo...do not pass Go, do not collect $200.  Most GP don't know that much about the thyroid.  Get an endo that specializes in thyroids not diabetes.  Hope you get some answers soon and fell better even sooner.  I've had a TT 3 months ago for Graves Disease & thyca.

go directly to the endo...skip the general doc...autoimmune thyroid disease...Hashimotos or Graves...with anitbodies like that probably Hashimotos...you have all the same symptoms I do and I have Hashimotos..plus I just had a lobectomy 11 days ago...

hi welcome I to had hasimotos with high antibodies as well get to an endo fast! You need better medical care to get you through some of the curves hasi's will throw at you. Let us know how you progress and welcome aboard...post any and all questions you have and finally your ranges are down right scary so run don't walk to a good endo and if you are not happy with the one you get then find a different one, the thing is this kind of hasi's can totally lead to heart trouble so don't wait to long.Lisa

Thanks ladies for the feedback.  I've got my first endo appt. on the 19th (next week).  At least I feel somewhat justified for all the exhaustion.  I have 3 small kids and just figured they were running me into the ground.  I wasn't even sure exactly HOW BAD the results were.

question: Last year, I was diagnosed with mild hypothyroidism and put on the smallest amount of synthroid available.  A few months ago, I noticed that I was experiencing severe depression, weight gain, physical pains, and cysts all over my body (bizarre symptom?).  My doc finally retested me:Anti-Throglobulin of 6292 (normal range below 40)TPO of 1239 (normal range below 35)...but normal TSH and Free T3????How can I have normal TSHs and have these abnormally high levels of everything else?  I don't have an enlarged goiter.DOES THIS MEAN I HAVE HASHIMOTO THYROIDITIS?  LAB REPORT JUST SAID AUTOIMMUNE THYROID DISEASE.  I HAVE A FOLLOW UP WITH MY PRIMARY CARE PHYSICIAN IN A FEW WEEKS, BUT DO YOU THINK I SHOULD JUST GO STRAIGHT TO AN ENDOCRINOLOGIST?  I'd love advice from those of you who are more experienced.
title: NEW DX. Anti-thyroglobulin of 6292 and TPO of 1239.
